moves.1. e4 c5: I immediately played c5 and hit the clock.
moves.2... d6: I thought for a while on this nove because I was most familiar with 2.... e6 and Nf6. I was playing a opponent who I know well. a6 and g6 is also possible.
moves.3. d4: Striking the centre. I get whites better d pawn but white gets quick development.
moves.3... cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3: Standard moves. I was considering the 3 main options ( g6, a6 and e6)  I didn't want to play the Dragon because I don't play it frequently.
moves.5... a6: The most aggressive line. Prepares for a minority attack.
moves.6. Bc4: The Sozin attack. Attacks the weak f7 square.
moves.6... b5: Gains tempo by attacking the bishop and allows my LSB to develop on the next move.
moves.7... Bb7: A lot of pressure is being put on the centre.
moves.8. f3: Protects the pawn on e4 and signals that whtie wants to castle queenside.
moves.8... e5: Attacks the well placed knight on d4 but gives me a backward pawn on d6
moves.10. Be3: It seems that he's developing the queenside to get ready to castle on it.
moves.10... O-O 11. Qd2 Nbd7 12. O-O: This move surprised me as White had the option to castle Queenside and could've easily started a pawn storm.
moves.12... h6: A Flight square for my king. Maybe better was 12.... Rc1
moves.13. Bxh6: It starts to get interesting here. I think that this was pointless and completely loses.
moves.13... gxh6 14. Qxh6: White doesn't have the material to successfully checkmate me. It gets really crazy from here
moves.14... Nh7: Makes way for my DSB and queen battery.
moves.15. f4: White tries to bring more pieces to the attack.
moves.15... exf4: Here I foolishly capture on f4.
moves.16. Rxf4: I miscalculated that He could play Rg4 pinning my bishop to the king if I ever tried to fork the rook and queen. I realised this just then.
moves.16... Kh8 17. h4: A kingside pawnstorm. He must be mad.
moves.17... Rg8: Here I blundered with Rg8. Far better was Bg6 which blocks the rooks attack on f7 and prepares the bishop to defend.
moves.20... Ne5: The white queen is in a pretty awkward position with no escape squares.
moves.21. Raf1: Doubles up. It was idiotic to not capture on g6.
moves.21... Qe6: I try to get the rook to g8.
moves.22. Ng3: I had some sort of feeling not to take the bishop on g6. I must;ve been drugged or something because that move stares you in the face.
moves.22... Rag8 23. Nf5 Nxg6 24. Nxg7 Rxg7 25: He tries to set up a trap. If the pawn is taken with the rook
moves.27. Nd5 Bg5 28. Rg4 Re6 29. b3: He begins to place his pawns on light squares as my LSB is out of action.
moves.29... Kg7 30. Rf5 Kh6 31. Nc7: He blunders here. He touched and moved his knight and after moving stared at me and hoped that I didn't notice his blunder.
moves.31... Rxe4 32. Rxe4 Bxe4 33. Rf2: Another blunder. I think he gave up here because before he made this move, he started to shake his head in disappointment.
moves.33... Be3: White is lost here although he may try to salvage a draw.
moves.34. Kf1 Bxf2 35. Kxf2 Bxc2 36. Nxa6 Bb1: White plays on to the lastmoment hoping for a draw. Here I just play around
I could've fallen into a hilarious mate after 63... Kg8 d3 64.Kg6 d2 Nh6#
moves.64. Nh6 d3 65. g8=Q+ Bxg8 66. Nxg8 d2 67: Here I mess around for a bit. I have about 3 minutes on the clock and my opponent has about 2.
